Description: Marl vase with high shoulder, flat base, low inset neck and roll rim. On the shoulder is an incised rectilinear potmark composed of several scratched lines made after the vase was fired.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Ahmar, Hierakonpolis Fort Cemetery
Curator's comments: This vase is from Garstang’s excavations. These were briefly reports in Annales du Service des Antiquites de l’Egypte 8 (1907), 134-7, with fuller publication of the surviving records by B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, London (1987), but there are mention of this vessel, probably because it was found loose and not in a particular grave. F for Fort Cemetery is marked on the vessel. Pottery type according to Petrie’s (1953) Corpus of Protodynastic pottery is 92j
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
